body:
We accept the fact of hypergamy, and that pisses people off.  You would think that a willingness to accept reality would be standard and no big deal, but think again.  Reality has always been a threat to some people.  It was a threat when people first figured out that the Earth was not the center of the universe.  That notion went against the church's teachings of the time, and they threw a fit over it.  

We've all seen evidence of hypergamy all our lives.  I remember back in high school, it used to annoy me that girls would go for "an older guy," often college or professional men in their early 20s, sometimes even older.  It annoyed the crap out of me, but it was just their natural hypergamy instincts talking.  They were attracted to men who already had some resources.  We see hypergamy run amok now in society, as women are no longer shamed by religion and cultural values to not sleep around.  However, now it's "girl power" for a woman to go behind her husband's back and shop for a lover or a replacement husband.  That behavior would have been despised in previous decades.  People were right back then and are wrong now.  That behavior is disgusting.  One used to work to override hypergamy with good values, values that said you take a vow to spend your life with one person and be loyal to that one person through thick and thin.  Nowadays the values are to serve women by allowing them to do whatever they whimsically desire.  We were a more moral society when we despised adultery.  

We MGTOW are honest that hypergamy exists.  We acknowledge men's bad instincts too.  Men do have violent instincts.  However, we're expected to use our intellects to keep those instincts in check.  That's demanded of a man, but not of a woman.  Women are being indulged with their base instincts.  We're only telling the truth when we say that women have instincts to trade up to a higher value mate.  Being honest somehow makes us the bad guy.  It's because the lunatic feminist movement is doing all it can to hide women's instincts.  They force a dogma down people's throats, exactly like the Church forced the geocentric dogma down its followers throats.  

Denying the existence of the hypergamous instinct makes as much sense as denying that woman's sexual marketplace value declines over time.  She's most desirable in her late teens and early to mid twenties.  That's just how human instinct and biology work.  No one set it up that way.  It came about via millions of years of evolution.  No one dreamed up an evil scheme to make life tough for women.  It's just biology.  Yet, men get blamed for it.  That makes as much sense as protesting against the rings of Saturn.  Saturn has rings.  If that upsets you, you're out of luck.  It's just how it is and no one can change it.  The women screaming that it's tougher to date in their 30s and 40s, might as well form a protest group to protest Saturns rings.  They could protest gravity as well.  It may be a fact of nature, but I'm sure they can find a way to twist it into an evil conspiracy against women.  "Gravity has been holding women down for centuries."  I suggest they go with that.

body:
Firstly, hypergamy, or the process of being attracted to a perceived 'better' mate, is a broad a catch-all term that does a poor job of capturing the changes in perception of what constitutes 'better' relative to her sexual cycle. 

A woman's perception of what is 'better' fluctuates according to a cyclical attraction: preference for Alpha-traits during peak fertility phase and Beta-traits during the low-fertility phase. During her peak fertility phase, a women will be attracted to masculine features and traits (broadly termed as Alpha) and at her low fertility phase, she will be attracted to men with more effeminate features and traits (broadly-termed as Beta). 

There are many studies proving women's dual-mating strategy (one recent example here, which I've written a lengthy reply to: https://ruqqus.com/+MGTOW/post/d5dy/double-mating-strategy-scientific-study-by).

Her sexual selection changes depending on her ovulation cycle.

Secondly, when a woman is in the phase where she is attracted to resources - it is actually her measurement of provisioning ability and she perceives this via signalling - in modern times a guy signals by wearing a fitting suit, a nice watch, holding keys to a flashy car catches more interest than a guy dressed in a T-shirt and sandals. 

In primitive times when no one owned anything (eg. the hunter-gatherer tribes that exist in remote jungles in Papua and Indonesia), even amongst the tribesmen there would always be individuals who would be relatively better at something eg. Tribesman A, would perhaps excel in hunting, and would signal his provisioning ability via a necklace of canine teeth from the various beasts he has killed; Tribesman B perhaps excelled at weaving fibres into clothes and would signal his provisioning ability via woven clothing, etc. 

Status perception also changes based on relative abundance/scarcity of the season - eg. During fruiting season when gathering is plentiful and stomachs are full, the relative status of the hunter A isn't high as compared to times when fruits are scarce, food is hard to gather and stomaches are hungry.

Firstly, hypergamy, or the process of being attracted to a perceived 'better' mate, is a broad a catch-all term that does a poor job of capturing the changes in perception of what constitutes 'better' relative to her sexual cycle.

A woman's perception of what is 'better' fluctuates according to a cyclical attraction: preference for Alpha-traits during peak fertility phase and Beta-traits during the low-fertility phase. During her peak fertility phase, a women will be attracted to masculine features and traits (broadly termed as Alpha) and at her low fertility phase, she will be attracted to men with more effeminate features and traits (broadly-termed as Beta).

There are many studies proving women's dual-mating strategy (one recent example here, which I've written a lengthy reply to: https://ruqqus.com/+MGTOW/post/d5dy/double-mating-strategy-scientific-study-by).

Her sexual selection changes depending on her ovulation cycle.

Secondly, when a woman is in the phase where she is attracted to resources - it is actually her measurement of provisioning ability and she perceives this via signalling - in modern times a guy signals by wearing a fitting suit, a nice watch, holding keys to a flashy car catches more interest than a guy dressed in a T-shirt and sandals.

In primitive times when no one owned anything (eg. the hunter-gatherer tribes that exist in remote jungles in Papua and Indonesia), even amongst the tribesmen there would always be individuals who would be relatively better at something eg. Tribesman A, would perhaps excel in hunting, and would signal his provisioning ability via a necklace of canine teeth from the various beasts he has killed; Tribesman B perhaps excelled at weaving fibres into clothes and would signal his provisioning ability via woven clothing, etc.

Status perception also changes based on relative abundance/scarcity of the season - eg. During fruiting season when gathering is plentiful and stomachs are full, the relative status of the hunter A isn't high as compared to times when fruits are scarce, food is hard to gather and stomaches are hungry.

We accept the fact of hypergamy, and that pisses people off.  You would think that a willingness to accept reality would be standard and no big deal, but think again.  Reality has always been a threat to some people.  It was a threat when people first figured out that the Earth was not the center of the universe.  That notion went against the church's teachings of the time, and they threw a fit over it.  

We've all seen evidence of hypergamy all our lives.  I remember back in high school, it used to annoy me that girls would go for "an older guy," often college or professional men in their early 20s, sometimes even older.  It annoyed the crap out of me, but it was just their natural hypergamy instincts talking.  They were attracted to men who already had some resources.  We see hypergamy run amok now in society, as women are no longer shamed by religion and cultural values to not sleep around.  However, now it's "girl power" for a woman to go behind her husband's back and shop for a lover or a replacement husband.  That behavior would have been despised in previous decades.  People were right back then and are wrong now.  That behavior is disgusting.  One used to work to override hypergamy with good values, values that said you take a vow to spend your life with one person and be loyal to that one person through thick and thin.  Nowadays the values are to serve women by allowing them to do whatever they whimsically desire.  We were a more moral society when we despised adultery.  

We MGTOW are honest that hypergamy exists.  We acknowledge men's bad instincts too.  Men do have violent instincts.  However, we're expected to use our intellects to keep those instincts in check.  That's demanded of a man, but not of a woman.  Women are being indulged with their base instincts.  We're only telling the truth when we say that women have instincts to trade up to a higher value mate.  Being honest somehow makes us the bad guy.  It's because the lunatic feminist movement is doing all it can to hide women's instincts.  They force a dogma down people's throats, exactly like the Church forced the geocentric dogma down its followers throats.  

Denying the existence of the hypergamous instinct makes as much sense as denying that woman's sexual marketplace value declines over time.  She's most desirable in her late teens and early to mid twenties.  That's just how human instinct and biology work.  No one set it up that way.  It came about via millions of years of evolution.  No one dreamed up an evil scheme to make life tough for women.  It's just biology.  Yet, men get blamed for it.  That makes as much sense as protesting against the rings of Saturn.  Saturn has rings.  If that upsets you, you're out of luck.  It's just how it is and no one can change it.  The women screaming that it's tougher to date in their 30s and 40s, might as well form a protest group to protest Saturns rings.  They could protest gravity as well.  It may be a fact of nature, but I'm sure they can find a way to twist it into an evil conspiracy against women.  "Gravity has been holding women down for centuries."  I suggest they go with that.

body:
At that time the church upheld the science of ptolemy.  You cannot be Copernicus, a lone observer, and just claim to the body of knowledge that it has been wrong for millennia even prior to the church's existence.  A good scientific community will not embrace such things with open arms.

That being said, Copernicus was wrong too and our understanding of the universe will continue to evolve for better or worse.

Your views aren't as concrete as you believe, and like anyone with an open mind who would observe the world objectively - your perception of reality will change.

Reality has always been a threat to some people. It was a threat when people first figured out that the Earth was not the center of the universe. That notion went against the church's teachings of the time, and they threw a fit over it.

We've all seen evidence of hypergamy all our lives. I remember back in high school, it used to annoy me that girls would go for "an older guy," often college or professional men in their early 20s, sometimes even older. It annoyed the crap out of me, but it was just their natural hypergamy instincts talking. They were attracted to men who already had some resources. We see hypergamy run amok now in society, as women are no longer shamed by religion and cultural values to not sleep around. However, now it's "girl power" for a woman to go behind her husband's back and shop for a lover or a replacement husband. That behavior would have been despised in previous decades. People were right back then and are wrong now. That behavior is disgusting. One used to work to override hypergamy with good values, values that said you take a vow to spend your life with one person and be loyal to that one person through thick and thin. Nowadays the values are to serve women by allowing them to do whatever they whimsically desire. We were a more moral society when we despised adultery.

We MGTOW are honest that hypergamy exists. We acknowledge men's bad instincts too. Men do have violent instincts. However, we're expected to use our intellects to keep those instincts in check. That's demanded of a man, but not of a woman. Women are being indulged with their base instincts. We're only telling the truth when we say that women have instincts to trade up to a higher value mate. Being honest somehow makes us the bad guy. It's because the lunatic feminist movement is doing all it can to hide women's instincts. They force a dogma down people's throats, exactly like the Church forced the geocentric dogma down its followers throats.

Denying the existence of the hypergamous instinct makes as much sense as denying that woman's sexual marketplace value declines over time. She's most desirable in her late teens and early to mid twenties. That's just how human instinct and biology work. No one set it up that way. It came about via millions of years of evolution. No one dreamed up an evil scheme to make life tough for women. It's just biology. Yet, men get blamed for it. That makes as much sense as protesting against the rings of Saturn. Saturn has rings. If that upsets you, you're out of luck. It's just how it is and no one can change it. The women screaming that it's tougher to date in their 30s and 40s, might as well form a protest group to protest Saturns rings. They could protest gravity as well. It may be a fact of nature, but I'm sure they can find a way to twist it into an evil conspiracy against women. "Gravity has been holding women down for centuries." I suggest they go with that.
post.title: We are hated for accepting reality

parent.body: Science changes its view with changing information.  Science does not say that things must be a certain way or else.  If better evidence comes along, it embraces it.  The church could have said, "You're entitled to your view," and then employed scientists to investigate it.  They could have found out much sooner that geocentric was wrong. Instead, they persecuted Galileo, forcing him to recant.

body: Science itself only exists because we believe that we can objectively and accurately describe the universe. The belief is derived from theological thought that perfect natural laws drive everything as a reflection of a creator and also that we are made in His image and are encouraged by Christ to understand Him. If there was not this belief, scientific pursuits would be meaningless. It is often taken for granted the centuries of theology and natural philosophy that have established this framework. Scientists are no longer philosophers and don't look into the why of things anymore, only how. Rarely have I seen introspection from the scientific community as their continued success has driven them to arrogance and has influenced other down a dangerous path which I could see the destruction of humanity. The praiseworthy scientist is now in essence ironically nihilist.

body:
>biology causes homosexuality. That's still a mystery to science. 

Not really.  Homosexuality is a recessive gene.  There are actually a lot of reasons that a smaller percent of non breeding men is a very good for species survival.  They basically can be workhorses without being burdens on resources (historically).   

There really is no such thing as homosexual/lesbian women.  That is a different topic though.

parent.body:
Firstly, hypergamy, or the process of being attracted to a perceived 'better' mate, is a broad a catch-all term that does a poor job of capturing the changes in perception of what constitutes 'better' relative to her sexual cycle. 

A woman's perception of what is 'better' fluctuates according to a cyclical attraction: preference for Alpha-traits during peak fertility phase and Beta-traits during the low-fertility phase. During her peak fertility phase, a women will be attracted to masculine features and traits (broadly termed as Alpha) and at her low fertility phase, she will be attracted to men with more effeminate features and traits (broadly-termed as Beta). 

There are many studies proving women's dual-mating strategy (one recent example here, which I've written a lengthy reply to: https://ruqqus.com/+MGTOW/post/d5dy/double-mating-strategy-scientific-study-by).

Her sexual selection changes depending on her ovulation cycle.

Secondly, when a woman is in the phase where she is attracted to resources - it is actually her measurement of provisioning ability and she perceives this via signalling - in modern times a guy signals by wearing a fitting suit, a nice watch, holding keys to a flashy car catches more interest than a guy dressed in a T-shirt and sandals. 

In primitive times when no one owned anything (eg. the hunter-gatherer tribes that exist in remote jungles in Papua and Indonesia), even amongst the tribesmen there would always be individuals who would be relatively better at something eg. Tribesman A, would perhaps excel in hunting, and would signal his provisioning ability via a necklace of canine teeth from the various beasts he has killed; Tribesman B perhaps excelled at weaving fibres into clothes and would signal his provisioning ability via woven clothing, etc. 

Status perception also changes based on relative abundance/scarcity of the season - eg. During fruiting season when gathering is plentiful and stomachs are full, the relative status of the hunter A isn't high as compared to times when fruits are scarce, food is hard to gather and stomaches are hungry.

body: So you *want* to be a slave to a collective that doesn't really exist? I hope you realize sooner or later that society and humans are fundamentally evil no matter how you frame it.
body_html: So you want to be a slave to a collective that doesn't really exist? I hope you realize sooner or later that society and humans are fundamentally evil no matter how you frame it.

post.body:
We accept the fact of hypergamy, and that pisses people off.  You would think that a willingness to accept reality would be standard and no big deal, but think again.  Reality has always been a threat to some people.  It was a threat when people first figured out that the Earth was not the center of the universe.  That notion went against the church's teachings of the time, and they threw a fit over it.  

We've all seen evidence of hypergamy all our lives.  I remember back in high school, it used to annoy me that girls would go for "an older guy," often college or professional men in their early 20s, sometimes even older.  It annoyed the crap out of me, but it was just their natural hypergamy instincts talking.  They were attracted to men who already had some resources.  We see hypergamy run amok now in society, as women are no longer shamed by religion and cultural values to not sleep around.  However, now it's "girl power" for a woman to go behind her husband's back and shop for a lover or a replacement husband.  That behavior would have been despised in previous decades.  People were right back then and are wrong now.  That behavior is disgusting.  One used to work to override hypergamy with good values, values that said you take a vow to spend your life with one person and be loyal to that one person through thick and thin.  Nowadays the values are to serve women by allowing them to do whatever they whimsically desire.  We were a more moral society when we despised adultery.  

We MGTOW are honest that hypergamy exists.  We acknowledge men's bad instincts too.  Men do have violent instincts.  However, we're expected to use our intellects to keep those instincts in check.  That's demanded of a man, but not of a woman.  Women are being indulged with their base instincts.  We're only telling the truth when we say that women have instincts to trade up to a higher value mate.  Being honest somehow makes us the bad guy.  It's because the lunatic feminist movement is doing all it can to hide women's instincts.  They force a dogma down people's throats, exactly like the Church forced the geocentric dogma down its followers throats.  

Denying the existence of the hypergamous instinct makes as much sense as denying that woman's sexual marketplace value declines over time.  She's most desirable in her late teens and early to mid twenties.  That's just how human instinct and biology work.  No one set it up that way.  It came about via millions of years of evolution.  No one dreamed up an evil scheme to make life tough for women.  It's just biology.  Yet, men get blamed for it.  That makes as much sense as protesting against the rings of Saturn.  Saturn has rings.  If that upsets you, you're out of luck.  It's just how it is and no one can change it.  The women screaming that it's tougher to date in their 30s and 40s, might as well form a protest group to protest Saturns rings.  They could protest gravity as well.  It may be a fact of nature, but I'm sure they can find a way to twist it into an evil conspiracy against women.  "Gravity has been holding women down for centuries."  I suggest they go with that.

body:
> We were communists.

And we still are, which is exactly the problem. It's just that the more people there are the harder it is to cover up evil and hypocrisy, so most of the world has been forced to abandon such tyranny at a governmental level. But it still exists socially almost everywhere. And all major ideologies, even ones that look like archenemies, are merely different types of excuses for communism.

body:
> They basically can be workhorses without being burdens on resources (historically).

I'm not gay but I have no sexual interest and it's highly unlikely that I'll ever want to breed. But I'm the opposite of a workhorse for society, even though my body and brain developed well for that I'm constantly jealous of women for getting to keep their self-fulfilling brain chemistry and bodies and having almost no expectations in life. And actually being taken seriously by others. Even if I wanted to be a workaholic I've grown to resent society for more reasons than I can count.

parent.body:
>biology causes homosexuality. That's still a mystery to science. 

Not really.  Homosexuality is a recessive gene.  There are actually a lot of reasons that a smaller percent of non breeding men is a very good for species survival.  They basically can be workhorses without being burdens on resources (historically).   

There really is no such thing as homosexual/lesbian women.  That is a different topic though.

* Criminals abuse and kill boys and men far more than girls and women
